titles.title: Mäṣḥafä gәbrä ḥǝmamat “Book of the Rite of the Holy Week”

shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Mäṣḥafä gәbrä ḥǝmamat “Book of the Rite of the Holy Week” (fols. 3ra-148vc) I-1) Introduction (fols. 3ra-5ra) I-2) Eve of Palm Sunday (fols. 5ra-7rb) I-3) Palm Sunday (fols. 7rb-13vb) I-4) Monday (fols. 13vb-27vc) - Night hours (fols. 13vb-15vc) - Day hours (fols. 15vc-27vc), including: Homily by John Chrysostom for Monday morning (fols. 19rc-20ra); Homily by John Chrysostom on the fig tree (fols. 20ra-22vc) I-5) Tuesday (fols. 27vc-41vc) - Night hours (fols. 27vc-29vb) - Day hours (fols. 29vb-41vc) I-6) Wednesday (fols. 41vc-51vc) - Night hours (fols. 41vc-43vb) - Day hours (fols. 43vb-51vc) I-7) Thursday (fols. 51vc-65vb) - Night hours (fols. 51vc-53vb) - Day hours (fols. 53vb-65vb) I-8) Friday (fols. 66ra-106vb) - Day hours (fols. 66ra-106vb), including: Homily by Jaqob of Serug on Abraham (fols. 79va-84va); Mäḥalǝyä mäḥalǝy “Song of Songs” (fols. 104rb-106rb) I-9) Saturday (fols. 106vb-138rc) - Night hours (fols. 106vb-138rc), including: Raʾǝyä Yoḥannǝs “Revelation of John” (fols. 110rc-120vc); Mäṣḥafä dorho “Book of the Cock” (fols. 121ra-130vb); Homily by Cyriacus of Behnesa [Laḥa Maryam “Lamentation of Mary”] (139ra-144ra) I-10) Sunday (fols. 144ra-148vc)
Additio 1.

copyists.copyist: Herenewos and Märḥa Ṣǝdǝq are mentioned as the scribes in Additio 1; other names are written but erased.

owners.owner: The church of ʾabunä Gäbrä Mänfäs Qǝddus ʾOna Maʾḍo, according to Additio 1.

dcomments.dcomment: King Yoḥannǝs IV (r. 1872-1889) is mentioned as the reigning monarch in a subscription in fol. 138rc, and in Additio 1.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards covered with reddish-brown tooled leather; textile inlays. Overback made of reddish leather. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bndecorations.bndecoration: Blind tooled ornament on the reddish-brown leather cover (at least 6 tools are used: double line fillet, single circle, interlaced line fillet, corni-form, double crescent, criss-cross)

bnothers.bnother: Traces of endband stitches (small holes) are visible at the spinefold of the quires.

squires.squire: A(2/fols. 1r-2v) – [፩]I(8/fols. 3r-10v) – ፪II(8; s.l.: 3, stub after 6; 6, stub after 3/fols. 11r-18v) – ፫III(8/fols. 19r-26v) – ፬IV(8; s.l.: 4, stub after 4; 5, stub after 3/fols. 27r-34v) – ፭V(8; s.l.: 4, stub after 4/fols. 35r-42v) – ፮VI(8/fols. 43r-50v) – ፯VII(7; s.l.: 3, stub after 5/fols. 51r-57v) – VIII(8; s.l.: 2, stub after 7; 7, stub after 2/fols. 58r-65v) – IX(8; s.l.: 3, stub after 5; 6, stub after 2/fols. 66r-73v) – ፪X(8/fols. 74r-81v) – ፫XI(8/fols. 82r-89v) – ፬XII(8/fols. 90r-97v) – ፭XIII(8/fols. 98r-105v) – ፮XIV(8; s.l.: 3, stub after 6; 6, stub after 3/ fols. 106r-113v) – XV(8/fols. 114r-121v) – XVI(9; s.l.: 1, stub after 9/fols. 122r-130v) – XVII(8/fols. 131r-138v) – XVIII(8/fols. 139r-146v) – XIX(2/fols. 147r-148v) – B(2/fols. 149r-150v)

taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; headings and incipits of the texts, their sections and subsections; a few lines are rubricated alternating with black lines on fols. 3r, 66r, 79va, 104rb, 110rc; titles of the Biblical books and other works; directives for the ministers; excerpts from hymns for the Good Friday (fols. 73r, 73v, 78r, 78v); names of Hebrew letters in fols. 97va-98rb (Lam. 3); the words yǝbe, yǝtärägwǝm, mätärgwǝm, sǝbuḥnni (fols. 100vc-101ra), ʾǝgziʾo täśahalännä (fols. 102vb-103va); the letter ʾo (fols. 107ra-107rc); the date in the ending subscription in fol. 130rc; elements of the punctuation signs; elements of the text dividers; elements of Ethiopic numerals.

abbreviations.abbreviation: ይሕ፡ for ይብል፡ ሕዝብ፡ ይካ፡ for ይብል፡ ካህን፡ ይዲ፡ for ይብል፡ ዲያቆን፡ ስቡሕኒ፡ for ስቡሕኒ፡ ውእቱ፡ ወልዑልኒ፡ ውእቱ፡ ለዓለም፡ (fols. 100vc-101ra) ኦ፡ for ኦእግዚእነ፡ ወመድኃኒነ፡ ኢየሱስ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ ኄር፡ (fols. 107ra-107rc)

otherdetails.otherdetail: - The work end with a subscription (fol. 138rc) in which King Yoḥannǝs IV (r. 1872-89) and Metropolitan ʾabunä Ṗetros (in tenure in 1883-1917) are mentioned. The indicated date (written in red ink), the 25th year of mercy of the kingdom of King Qwäsṭänṭinos, during the tenure of ʾabba Mikaʾel, nǝburä ʾǝd, probably refers to the time of the composition of the work.

additional.det: Written by the same hand as that of the main text. Other names are mentioned, Gäbrä Rufaʾel Näbǝlä Mikaʾǝl, Gäbrä Mädḫǝn, Gäbrä ʾIyäsus along with the scribes' names, Herenewos and Märḥa Ṣǝdǝq. The last two lines are erased.

extras.extra: - Excerpts from hymns for the Good Friday are added in the upper margin of fols. 73r, 73v, 78r, 78v). - Spaces for rubricated words left unfilled, e.g., fols. 18vc, 86vb, 120vc. - Writing excercises: fols. 1v, 149r.

txquiremarks.txquiremark: - Undecorated quire marks are written in the upper margin of fols. 11r, 19r, 27r, 35r, 43r, 51r, 74r, 82r, 90r, 98r, 106r.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: - Thread is inserted between fols. 63v and 64r and in the upper corner of fol. 103.

frames.frame: Fol. 3r: elaborate coloured ornamental band; geometrical, anthropomorphic motifs. Fol. 66r: three narrow simple uncoloured ornamental bands; interlaces motifs. Fols. 104rb, 110rb: narrow coloured ornamental bands; geometric motifs.
